title.narrative: Inclusive Private Sector Enabling Environment - CIPE Consortia
Inclusive Private Sector Enabling Environment - CIPE Consortia

description.narrative: CIPE and its consortia will pursue the following two objectives during the project: Objective 1: To empower marginalized groups and communities to participate effectively in and benefit from economic development and trade Objective 2: To strengthen the ability of the private sector to engage in effective policy reform that leads to positive regulatory and policy changes conducive for the Ethiopian private sector at the national, regional, and sub-regional levels

Det föreslagna initiativet syftar till en bottom-up modell och en lokal strategi till den privata sektorns utveckling för att möjliggöra ökandet av storleken på den privata sektorn, dess organisatoriska kapacitet och dess politiska samt ekonomiska roll. Vidare syftar den till att nyttja den nuvarande politiska viljan och ett befintligt engagemang för att möjliggöra utveckling av den privata sektorn för ökad tillväxt, samt för en starkare dialog mellan den privata- och offentliga sektorn.

The proposed initiative aims for a bottom-up and local approach to private sector development in order to increase the size of private sector, its organizational capacity, and its political and economic role. Further more, it aims to seize the current opportunity of political will and commitment for opening up of the environment for private sector development and inclusive growth for a stronger private public dialogues.

tag.narrative: 8.3 - Främja utvecklingsinriktad politik som stöder produktiv verksamhet, skapande av anständiga arbetstillfällen, företagande, kreativitet och innovation samt uppmuntra att mikroföretag liksom små och medelstora företag växer och blir en del av den formella ekonomin, bland annat genom tillgång till finansiella tjänster.

8.3 - Promote development-oriented policies that support productive activities, decent job creation, entrepreneurship, creativity and innovation, and encourage the formalization and growth of micro-, small- and medium-sized enterprises, including through access to financial services.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: - More than 70 women entrepreneurs, infomral business and women with disabilities facing financial hardships due to COVID were supported through a revolvong loan fund to restart their business; - To take into account of the evolving challenges of COVID 19, a rapid survey assessment of Ethiopian BMOs was conducted as part of a baseline and nedds assessment data to further inform implementation in the coming years. This was coupled with a report on Association Responses to COVID-19 to provide a review of best practices from around the continent that can be adopted by Ethiopian associations - Three private sector coalitions in Benshangul-Gumuz, Oromia and Somali regions are established with an aim to support the inclusion of marginal economic actors in local policy reform processes. - The project initiatied support (financial + technical) support for 38 business membership organizations as part of the Innovative Grants Fund (IGF). Over 40 % of the selected beneficiaries represent marginal economic actors. - In partnership with the Federal Jobs Creation Commission (JCC), the consortium facilitated capacity building activities for One Stop Service Centers (OSSCs), focusing on how to effectively use the JCC’s newly developed Labor Market Information System (LMIS) database. - In partnership with the Ethiopian Chamber of Commerce and Sectoral Associations (ECCSA), the project established a steering committee and working groups focusing on key thematic areas (SMEs, good governance, business infrastructure, AfCFTA and job creation) to coordinate the 2021 national PPD process and mayors conference. - The consortium facilitated a consultation meeting with ECCSA’s leadership on the topic of rules of origin and developed 3 well received AfCFTA support documents to be shared with ECCSA’s members
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
